net.proteusframework.core

Class StringFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.StringFactory

  • public class StringFactory
extends Object
    The StringFactory class provides several methods to process strings
    Author:
    Yongjia Ni (yni@i2rd.com), Pat Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • capitalize

        public static String capitalize(String s,
                char... delimiters)
        Capitalize the string based on the delimiters or whitespace if no delimiters are specified.
        Parameters:
        s - the string.
        delimiters - optional delimiters.
        Returns:
        the capitalized string.

      • convertToProgrammaticName2

        @Nullable
@Contract(value="null -> null")
public static String convertToProgrammaticName2(@Nullable
                                                  String pname)
        Converts a string into a programmatic name. This removes leading and trailing white space, then converts internal whitespace, hyphens, and periods to '_'. Then any non-alphanumeric characters are stripped. The result is a name with only letters, numbers, and underscores. The set of possible results is a subset of the possible results from convertToProgrammaticName.
        Parameters:
        pname - the name to convert. Can be null, in which case null is returned.
        Returns:
        the parameter but in the new programmatic name format. Null if pname is null.

      • convertToUpperLower

        protected static String convertToUpperLower(String s,
                         int offset,
                         int count,
                         boolean upper)
        Converts a range of chracters in a string to upper or lower based on the selection of the upper boolean.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to convert.
        offset - The starting index for the conversion (0 based).
        count - The number of charcters starting at the offset to convert.
        upper - True to make them uppercase, false to make them lowercase.
        Returns:
        The converted string.

                           boolean encode)
                                    throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Create an HTTP query string from the Map.
        Parameters:

        enc - the encoding.
        encode - true to encode, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The query string.

        UnsupportedEncodingException - if the specified encoding is not supported.

      • escape

        @Nullable
@Contract(value="null,_,_->null;!null,_,_->!null")
public static String escape(String str,
                              String esc,
                              char c)
        Escapes characters in a string using a given escape character. The characters to be escaped will be prefixed by the escape character.
        Parameters:
        str - The String to escape
        esc - A set of characters that need to be escaped
        c - The ecape character
        Returns:
        The escaped String

      • escapeForJavascript

        public static String escapeForJavascript(String str)
        Escapes a string for use as JavaScript data.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        The escaped string.

      • escapeForSqlLikePattern

        @Nullable
@Contract(value="null->null;!null->!null")
public static String escapeForSqlLikePattern(String pattern)
        Escapes a string so it can be used in a 'like' or 'ilike' query as the pattern without having any wildcards being present in the pattern. This is useful for constructing a pattern that you want to match exactly except for the addition of a prefix or postfix wildcards that you add after escaping. This can also be useful when using ilike to do a case-insensitive equality check.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern. If this is null, then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the escaped pattern, '_' and '%' will be escaped.

                     String charset)

        Parameters:

        charset - the character set.
        Returns:

      • getCharSet

        protected static boolean[] getCharSet(String set)
        Converts a set of characters from a String to a boolean array for faster lookup. The length of the array depends on the highest character value in the set.
        Parameters:
        set - The set of characters
        Returns:
        A boolean array indexed by character value, true if character is in the set, false otherwise.

      • parseHttpQueryString

        public static Map<String,Object> parseHttpQueryString(String query)
        Parse an HTTP query string into a map. The values of the Map will be a String for a single value and String[] for multiple key values.
        Parameters:
        query - the query string.
        Returns:
        Map of name, value pairs from the query string. If query string is empty or null, an empty map is returned.

      • parseNumberRange

        public static List<Long> parseNumberRange(String values)
        Parse number ranges.
        Example input:
        • 1
        • 1,1,2,3,5,8,13
        • 1-5
        • 1-5,20-70
        • 1-5,7,9,11,20-70
        Parameters:
        values - the values.
        Returns:
        the list of values.

      • toList

        @Nullable
@Contract(value="null,_,_->null;!null,_,_->!null")
public static List<String> toList(String str,
                                    String delim,
                                    boolean includeEmptyElements)
        Splits a delimited String to a List
        Parameters:
        str - The String
        delim - The delimiter
        includeEmptyElements - Specifies whether or not to return null in instances where there are two delimeters with no element between them.
        Returns:
        A List containing the splitted String

      • toList

        public static List<String> toList(String str,
                  String delim,
                  char escapeChar)
        This method is the compliment to toString(collection, delim, escapeChar). It splits a delimited String to a List, replacing any escaped delimeters with just the delimeter.
        Parameters:
        str - The String. If you pass in null you'll get an empty list.
        delim - The delimiter
        escapeChar - The escape character.
        Returns:
        A List containing elements from the splitted String. Never returns null

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(String number,
          long defaultValue)
        Convert a number.
        Parameters:
        number - the number as a string.
        defaultValue - default value if number is not parseable.
        Returns:
        the integer or default value.

        public static String toLower(String s,
             int offset,
             int count)
        Converts a range of characters in a String to lower case.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to convert.
        offset - The starting index for conversion. 0 is the first index.
        count - The number of characters starting at offset to convert.
        Returns:
        The converted String.

      • toString

        @Contract(value="null,_ -> null")
@Nullable
public static String toString(@Nullable
                                Collection<?> c,
                                String delim)
        Concatenate the elements of a Collection to a String.
        Parameters:
        c - The Collection
        delim - The delimiter
        Returns:
        A String containing the elements of the Collection separated by the specified delimiter. Null is returned if the specified Collection is null.

                                @Nonnull
                                String delim,
                                char escapeChar)
        Concatenate the elements of a Collection to a String after escaping the elements using escapeChar.

        delim - The delimiter
        escapeChar - The escape character
        Returns:

public static String toString(List<?> arrayBackedList,
                                String delim)
        Concatenate the elements of a ArrayList to a String.
        Parameters:
        arrayBackedList - The ArrayList
        delim - The delimiter
        Returns:
        A String containing the elements of the ArrayList seperated by the specified delimiter. Null is returned if the specified ArrayList is null.

             int offset,
             int count)
        Converts a range of characters in a String to upper case.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to convert.
        offset - The starting index for conversion. 0 is the first index.
        count - The number of characters starting at offset to convert.
        Returns:
        The converted String.

      • truncateWords

        @Nullable
@Contract(value="null,_->null;!null,_->!null")
public static String truncateWords(String str,
                                     int chars)
        Truncate a String at the specified position. If the String is shorter than the specified length, it will be intact. Otherwise it will be truncated at the end of the word at the specified position and "..." will be appended to it.
        Parameters:
        str - The string.
        chars - The maximum number of characters.
        Returns:
        A truncated String

      • wordWrap

        @Nullable
@Contract(value="null,_,_,_->null;!null,_,_,_->!null")
public static String wordWrap(String str,
                                int lineLength,
                                String separator,
                                Locale locale)
        Wrap a string to the desired line length. If the string is null or the string length is smaller than the desired lineLength, str will be returned. If str has separator in it, these separators will be preserved. If locale is null, default locale will be used.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be wraped
        lineLength - the desired line length
        separator - the line separator
        locale - the locale. if null, use default
        Returns:
        a new string with line separators inserted at proper location
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the desired lineLength is less than 1 or the separator is null or the lineLength is less than the longest word in the string.
